FuncDef:
The data-delay-time command sets a hold-off time for an mLDP P2MP tunnel to go Up.
The undo data-delay-time command deletes the hold-off time set for an mLDP P2MP tunnel to go Up.
By default, no hold-off time is set for an mLDP P2MP tunnel to go Up.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a hold-off time for an mLDP P2MP tunnel to go Up.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 300, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
On a multicast EVPN, if you want an mLDP P2MP tunnel to go Up after all leaf nodes are configured, run the data-delay-time delay-time command to set a hold-off time for the mLDP P2MP tunnel to go Up.
